alert.note: Alert for Carter; Garvin; Johnston; Love; Marshall; McClain; Murray; Pontotoc (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 24 at 10:27AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Johnston, northeastern Garvin, northeastern Love, southern Seminole, southeastern Carter, Pontotoc, northwestern Marshall, eastern Murray, south central Pottawatomie and southeastern McClain Counties through 1115 AM CDT... At 1027 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles north of Stratford to 7 miles west of Roff to 3 miles southeast of Dougherty to 3 miles east of Lake Murray. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Ardmore, Ada, Sulphur, Madill, Tishomingo, Stratford, Konawa, Dickson, Byng, Mannsville, Roff, Ravia, Stonewall, Bowlegs, Asher, Wanette, Mill Creek, Milburn, Francis and Byars. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Carter; Garvin; Johnston; Love; Marshall; McClain; Murray; Pontotoc
